DOC.brief_summary: Study Aim : To determine feasibility treatment effect multi-component intervention combine non-drug treatment urinary incontinence , physical activity , environmental modification prevent toileting disability frail old woman live senior housing facility . Hypothesis 1 : Treatment group participants 15 % improvement toileting skill measure performance time toileting instrument compare improvement woman assign treatment group Hypothesis 2 : Treatment group participants improvement urinary incontinence severity frequency , quality life relate urinary incontinence , physical function , barrier toileting compare improvement treatment group participant
DOC.brief_title: Defeating Urinary Incontinence With Exercise Training ( DUET ) Feasibility Study
DOC.criteria: Female Age 60 year old Have urinary incontinence Not currently meet national recommendation physical activity ( 150 minute weekly moderate intensity aerobic exercise twice weekly strength building exercise . At risk functional decline per Vulnerable Elders Survey ( score 3+ ) Free dementia ( pas minicog screen ) Cognitive impairment Grade 4 vaginal prolapse pessary use Orthopedic surgery past year Urinary retention ( catheter use ) Neurological cause urinary incontinence ( i.e . Parkinson 's Disease , MS ) Bladder cancer Bladder incontinence surgery past year Recipient hospice palliative care Ostomy New prescription dosage change past three month antiincontinence medication
